content.text1: We love kids and youth—and because of that we highly value the time we are able to be with them.

list.title: Kids
list.text: Kidmax is our Sunday morning kids program for infants to grade 5s. We exist to help kids understand and live Jesus' message, develop relationships through small group experiences, equip our community to invest in our kids, and partner with parents as they raise disciples. Kids hang out in small groups for activities and discussion from our curriculum, so kids can get to know one another and their leaders as they explore faith together.
list.imageAlt: Kids laughing and playing together in our kidmax program.

list.title: Youth
list.text: We walk alongside our youth as they learn to love and follow Jesus, sharing his message with others. Jr. Highs (grades 6-8) hang out together on Sunday mornings for activities and discussion from our curriculum. Sr. Highs (grades 9-12) gather in the service with our wider church family. Both groups come together midweek to have fun, engage in small groups and talk about Jesus.
list.imageAlt: Two youth laughing together at a youth retreat.

list.title: Parents and Guardians
list.text: We are passionate about helping with spiritual parenting. We provide take-home resources with questions and activities to further learning at home. Follow along on The Parent Blog to learn what kids learned this past Sunday and for other helpful resources.
list.imageAlt: Two parents walking with their young child.

content.text1: Our mission is to develop lifelong followers of Jesus. Our approach is to teach stories within the context of the overarching Biblical narrative, so that kids and youth can learn each story and how it connects into God’s story. We also want kids and youth to see where they fit into God’s story, and discover the role that God has for them as disciples of Jesus. Our teaching moves from the Old Testament, to the life of Jesus, to the early Church.
